message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of disseminating information in a network, which is a classic topic in distributed computing (cs.DC). The use of push and pull operations and the consideration of stochastic failures suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of networked systems (cs.NI). The fact that the algorithms are address-oblivious and robust against failures may make the paper relevant to the sub-category of systems and control (cs.SY). The use of information theory techniques to analyze the communication complexity of the algorithms may also make the paper relevant to the sub-category of information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the consideration of multiple rumors and the use of randomized algorithms may suggest that the paper is relevant to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
